title: Modern Nomads Unite!
name: Modern Nomads Unite!
description:
A Map by Nomademoderne

Where have you travelled?  Add pictures and descriptions here.

properties.name: Austria
properties.description: Posted by NomademoderneI spent a summer here as part of a graduate student program at a scientific institute. Also had a chance to travel around a little bit, including to a great little town up in the mountains, Salzburg and into some of the wine growing area.

properties.name: Brasil
properties.description: Posted by NomademoderneMy trip there in September 2005 included Rio, Salvador, Brasilia, Manaus and a boat ride up the Amazon.

properties.name: Cambodia
properties.description: Posted by NomademoderneTwo trips here for research in 2005

properties.name: Canada
properties.description: Posted by NomademoderneI moved here as a kid, initially to Montreal and then the Toronto suburbs. I left for school, came back to get my Masters degree, went back to the U.S. and have now moved back and make Vancouver my home.

properties.name: Cayman Islands
properties.description: Posted by NomademoderneI spent a christmas on Little Cayman, which is absolute paradise if you just want to escape the world. There is one paved road, a dirt-strip runway and maybe 50 people who live year-round on the island.

properties.name: China
properties.description: Posted by NomademoderneI went to China three times for research in 2005, including Beijing, Hangzhou, Hubei Province and Zhejiang Province.

properties.name: Czech Republic
properties.description: Posted by NomademoderneDuring my summer in Austria (2003), some friends of mine and I came to Prague for a long weekend. It\'s a great city, lots of fun and very interesting. Definitely worth a return trip.

properties.name: Egypt
properties.description: Posted by NomademoderneLived here for about five months back in 1993 on a study abroad program. I wasn\'t crazy about Cairo, but visiting the Sinai was amazing and the tour of the ancient Egyptian tombs and sites from Aswan to Luxor in the south was pure heaven for me.

properties.name: England
properties.description: Posted by Nomademoderne

properties.name: Germany
properties.description: Posted by NomademoderneJena, GermanyLots of trips to Germany recently for personal reasons :)

properties.name: Hungary
properties.description: Posted by NomademoderneSpent just a weekend in Budapest in 2003, but I would love to go back.

properties.name: India
properties.description: Posted by NomademoderneMy first trip was Dec. 2004 and was to Bombay for a wedding, Delhi for work, and then Udaipur and Jaipur for vacation. I did a return trip but that was all work. I\'m looking forward to going back someday to explore further south.

properties.name: Mexico
properties.description: Posted by NomademoderneSince my parents moved to this wonderful country a few years back, I\'ve had numerous occasions to visit, mainly to San Miguel de Allende.

properties.name: Morocco
properties.description: Posted by NomademoderneThe country of my birth, though I left when I was quite young. On my return trips I have traveled around fairly extensively, though there is always more to see.

properties.name: New Zealand
properties.description: Posted by NomademoderneWent for a conference, but had the good fortune (good sense?) to stay a few extra days and go kayaking in Abel Tasman. Fantastic trip.

properties.name: Palestinian Territories
properties.description: Posted by NomademoderneI spent about 2.5 months living here in the summer of 2001 (Beit Jala, just next to Bethlehem). I also spent time in Jerusalem, particularly East Jerusalem and the old city.

properties.name: Sydney, Australia
properties.description: Posted by Nomademoderne

properties.name: Thailand
properties.description: Posted by NomademoderneUnfortunately I spent most of my time in Bangkok in a meeting room in the hotel. But I did get one day to explore Bangkok, took a boat tour, visited the palace, saw the big reclining buddha, etc.

properties.name: The United States of America
properties.description: Posted by NomademoderneOver the course of 15 years I lived in Ohio (Oberlin), Pennsylvania (Pittsburgh), California (Menlo Park), and three stints in Washington DC. I driven across (or nearly across) the country four times and visited a good number of the states (but nowhere near all of them).
